How would you explain the idea of neural networks to a person who has no technical experience? Write a clear explanation that even a five-year-old can understand.
[HTML Page]
Neural networks are like a big brain made up of tiny parts called neurons. Just like how we use our brains to learn and remember things, a neural network can learn from information it receives and use that information to make decisions or solve problems. It's like having a robot brain that can think and learn on its own!

What is a Neural Network?

Imagine a neural network as a giant, magical brain made up of lots of tiny parts called "neurons." These neurons are like little helpers that work together to learn and remember things!

Just like how you learn new things at school or from your parents, a neural network learns from the information it receives. It listens carefully and tries to understand patterns, just like when you learn that the sky is blue or that 2 + 2 equals 4.

Once it learns something, the neural network can use that information to make decisions or solve problems. It's like having a super-smart robot brain that can think and learn all by itself. Isn't that cool?
